intro: Cyrtopera aloifolia, commonly known as the silver leaf tree, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant has a woody structure with a spreading canopy, making it suitable for ornamental landscaping. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Cyrtopera aloifolia is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and birds.
